ratings.comment: I took several of his classes in the late 70's.  Sorry he is retired, but happy that my son got to learn from him first.  Perhaps the most incredible intellect I've encountered face-to-face, yet modest with a great sense of humor.  Sublime philosophical concepts seemed to affect him in the same manner as beautiful music does other people.

The greatest teacher ever? It's certainly a possibility. Love his classes and miss him dearly. Is there any chance the dept can hire another like him? -- Someone to do Kant, Rousseau, Leibniz, Plato???

Patrick is the single greatest professor I have ever had.  Not only do I attributed my knowledge and understanding of philosophy, politics, religion, etc. to Patrick, but also for helping get into graduate school.  I hope that he knows how much he is appreciated by the student body and the last remaining value of Madison’s Political Science departm

Easily one of the best profs I have ever had.  This man is a genius, and I came to love his lectures.  Don't be dismayed if at first you feel as though you are in over your head, as lecture definitely takes some getting used to (he uses few outlines).  However, he is a very genuine person and will assist anyone looking for help...great man!

Amazing professor.  One of my top 5 favorites in my four years at Madison.  Absolute genious, makes philosophy very interesting.  Recommend the class to anyone.  Don't need to go to lecture to do well but I wouldn't miss one.  It's far too interesting.  Great guy!

Not classically attractive, yet pleasant to look at. He is known to ask the class permission to remove one article of clothing. Is also known to give lectures on stoicism following electoral disappointments. Vastly entertaining and a veritable cornucopia of learning.

Brilliant lectures, but can be tough to follow.  Cares about students-his philosophy of education seems to be that you get what you want to out of the class.  LOTS of reading, but you can focus on 2-3 authors if need be.  I love him and his classes (I took everything that he offered here.
No Comments
He's great!  Hysterically enthusiastic to the point that he wiggles his eyebrows to emphasize important things.  I'd definitely take another of his classes!
He is interesting and the course is pretty straightforward. He is Bilbo Baggins I think! (And that's a good thing!)
He's my favorite UW professor!

Awesome! Anyone can get an A in this class. If you are assertive and try to be demanding with Professor Riley, you will get whatever grade you want because he just HATES confrontation. So confront him and get yourself an A!
he's the man!
Rambles on a lot & gets side tracked easily, but if your interested in the topic it can be amusing.
GREAT professor.  Highly reccomended.
very cool hair!
Amazingly intelligent!
One of the most intelligent people I've heard lecture.
Best teacher ever
Very Animated -- Mad Genious type...
Brilliant, passionate, kind and quirky.  A rare gem.
